titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Standing Committee on Professional Awareness, Yale University Library, Records
Standing Committee on Professional Awareness, Yale University Library, Records
titlestmt.author: compiled by Daniel Hartwig

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Thursday January 10, 2019 at 11:55

did.unittitle: Standing Committee on Professional Awareness, Yale University Library, records

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The records consist of memoranda, minutes, agendas, videotapes, and correspondence documenting the operations and activities of the Standing Committee on Professional Awareness (SCOPA) at Yale University Library.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Forms part of Yale Record Group 32-F (YRG 32-F), Records of Yale University Library staff organizations.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the materials is partially restricted. See inventory for details.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Standing Committee on Professional Awareness, Yale University Library, Records (RU 154). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The records are arranged by accession.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The records consist of memoranda, minutes, agendas, videotapes, and correspondence documenting the operations and activities of the Standing Committee on Professional Awareness (SCOPA) at Yale University Library.

did.unittitle: Records of SCOPA and co-chair subject files

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: No online inventory. Inventory available in repository.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Original audiovisual materials, as well as preservation and duplicating masters, may not be played. Researchers must consult use copies, or if none exist must pay for a use copy, which is retained by the repository. Researchers wishing to obtain an additional copy of non-commercially produced items for their personal use should consult the ordering reproductions information on the Manuscripts and Archives web site.
